title: Can Taric ignore unit collision while his dazzle is charging?
body: If you're trying to run someone down in a 2 v 2 during the charge up time, you can be swerved out of alignment by a minion and miss the stun completely. It's hard to predict when this will happen and it can drastically effect a skirmish if you cant get the stun.

replies.body: I'm pretty sure Repertoire considered this when he worked on the Taric update. Lucian for instance gets it for his R for the same reason. I'm going to trust that we decided not to give him ghost during the E delay for good reason; I'd assume it's too much invisible power to add on something that can be used relatively frequently (it's not an ult). I'd be sad to see Taric use E while running away just to path through minions.

> [{quoted}](name=ZenonTheStoic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AR7o7E0u,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2017-06-09T19:15:19.638+0000)

I'm going to trust that we decided not to give him ghost during the E delay for good reason; I'd assume it's too much invisible power to add on something that can be used relatively frequently (it's not an ult). I'd be sad to see Taric use E while running away just to path through minions.

then fix creep block.

> [{quoted}](name=Cosmic Warper,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AR7o7E0u,comment-id=000d0003,timestamp=2017-06-09T20:33:46.533+0000)

> [{quoted}](name=ZenonTheStoic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AR7o7E0u,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2017-06-09T19:15:19.638+0000)
>
>  I'd be sad to see Taric use E while running away just to path through minions.

would it be possible to give him ghosting only when he's going _toward_ other champions then? maybe also make it so he only goes through minions, and not champions as well? there are so many times where i'll be trying to line up a dazzle and get redirected by pathing around minions at the last second, i would just like this change :(

Part of mastering Taric is learning to angle your E knowing that minions get in the way.  You can't point it straight at the enemy when minions are in the way.  You have to angle it a little in anticipation of having to go around something.  As a Taric main, I am against the idea of giving him ghost.
But what if you walk towards enemies, then want to back out and now you're stuck on the other side of the minions? Makes it hard to turn around if you have too

"would it be possible to give him ghosting only when he's going _toward_ other champions then?  "       ---------------------------          I like this idea a lot. As a taric main I agree that a full time ghosting would be to much, but this would be a good solution to fix this issue.
Slapping a "only when moving towards enemies" effect is a band-aid solution.

{{champion:103}} {{champion:103}}{{champion:103}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:103}} 

Literally. Get. Another. Job.

I'm actually sick to death of inconsistent design philosophy. Like, you'll write a freakin' essay defending one champion while being completely oblivious to the elephant in the room. And the champion you're arguing against is usually Tier 2 or lower (tier 2 being below God Tier and Tier 1).

NOT TO MENTION Creep block (more specifically: Ally Creep Block) is a cancerous mechanic that should not exist. It should never have existed. The only reasonable excuse for creep block ever existing I can think of is that the technology available during the inception of LoL didn't allow for a unit to not block movement.

And why would that be sad? No one at Riot seems to be sad about riven spamming her mini dashes to run away or get to the lane faster or lee's wardhops or elise plant hops. But a tank with 0 additional mobility from skills (not even some form of pathetic movement speed boost)?! Now that's just too far. Way too much outplay potential for some pleb tank.

In all seriousness though, give the guy at least a mini speed boost during stun charge.

I sat and thought about this. You use your e backwards when running away anyhow. I don't think anyone would expend it for unit passing when you need it to peel someone that catches you because you move like a glacier.

Can you give some feedback on this if you have the time? please and thankyou

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/40zsGgn0-riot-can-ahris-foxfire-get-some-kind-of-qol-on-the-targeting-side
That'd be pretty dumb, all things considered. If he wants to stun me, he should have to put himself in a position to do it, not get a free pass through my defense wall of minions.
coming from a mastery lvl6 taric support main it would be nice but that's his only counterplay other than his small start on mana
People can still dodge it, I've had times where I click forward and Taric moves in a different direction because of the minions moving around.
would be funny to see a taric run {{summoner:6}} and {{item:3046}} just for the unit collision passives

Why both? Moving through units isn't a stacking passive.

But Imma go try it in ranked anyway.

It does stack though.

It just happens that infinity times 2 is still infinity.

> [{quoted}](name=TTK Techno,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AR7o7E0u,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-06-08T20:49:30.678+0000)
>
> would be funny to see a taric run {{summoner:6}} and {{item:3046}} just for the unit collision passives

I'm a Mastery 7 Taric. If you get far enough ahead to buy Phantom Dancer, You'd be shocked at how insane he is with that and IBG.

''lmao Taric top what can he even d-'' ''YOU HAVE BEEN SLAIN''

**FIRST BLOOD**

''{{champion:44}} has killed {{champion:92}}''
The counterplay is dodging, not getting lucky that he got creepblocked

how is it lucky if you run in a path such that minions block his chase???
like creepblock is pretty bullshit most of the time but not in this case
Minion dies, minions swap aggro to Taric because he's closest to them, creepblocked.

You could literally say that about any skillshot.
Minion dies, minion swaps aggro to Ahri, blocks charm.
Minion dies, minion swaps aggro to Gragas, blocks bodyslam.
Like come on.

It's far less likely that those two get blocked. Ahri usually isn't close enough to take aggro from minions. Grag E probably would have been blocked regardless. The tiniest movement from a minion can push Taric enough to make him miss E.

Only if Zac gets to ignore unit collision when he's within 25 units of a blob and moving towards it.

Yes I know he's overtuned right now and obviously he should be nerfed as well, but I don't think it would be crazy to have less "No fuck you you don't get to pick up your blob that's right there"
Maybe an increased radius for picking up blobs would be better than that, IDK.

Coming from a Taric one-trick (Currently Gold 5. Mastery lvl 7 on Taric) This is would be extremely helpful. However, while this would certainty feel good for the Taric player, it might remove the need for proper positioning with your stun, which is the thing that keeps the ability balanced in the first place.

OTOH taric's stun is his only proactive move - and even with ghost, it is much more viable to use his stun in a reactive manner - i.e. to piggyback the stun on a mobile ally. 

Aren't you annoyed, as a taric player, but his lack of proactive moves?

> [{quoted}](name=Aptest,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AR7o7E0u,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2017-06-10T15:28:46.258+0000)

No. He's not an offense character. He is a warden. A bruiser/support that brick walls enemy melees.

Hey Skias, Weird to see you somewhere that isn't the Taric Mains Subreddit, lol

Edit: But yeah, totally agree with you on that.

> [{quoted}](name=Toadally,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AR7o7E0u,comment-id=000b000000010000,timestamp=2017-06-10T16:19:45.447+0000)
>
> Hey Skias, Weird to see you somewhere that isn't the Taric Mains Subreddit, lol
> 
> Edit: But yeah, totally agree with you on that.

Haha, yeah I prefer talking Taric there. There is a ton of people on here that give opinions on Taric while never playing him. He's a versatile champ but most people just think he sits back and spams w and q.

Nah, with enough experience you learn to use your E and R proactively, sure, it's hard, and not always even possible, but when you do pull it off it feels so much better than if you were just able to do it all the time. Besides, I always viewed Taric as the champion that makes another champion more op than everybody else in the game, with heals, shields, a tacked on stun, and invulnerability, so when you look at it with that context, being mostly reactive isn't a bad thing.


Side note: While he may lack reliable proactive moves, his passive makes it feel like every spell you cast, whether offensively or defensively, has a lot more impact than it really does, his passive is probably my favorite thing about him TBH.

I'm with you there. Satisfaction of watching high DPS champs lose trade to bravado mixed with the sound it makes is great.

Yep, nothing beats it, Acutally have a couple of clips to showcase that

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8iZaC0Pz9so

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rGrdHW89EjU

But yeah, gotta love that satisfying smack sound effect.
I echo thoughts said by others that this would be too strong. {{summoner:6}} is a much better solution if you want that.
Taric can't afford to run ghost. Flash stuns are too powerful to pass up, and you are pretty fucked without a combat summoner.

I think Taric can afford to run ghost if you really want to ignore unit collision. 

In my opinion, unit collision isn't a serious problem for Taric. But if someone else thinks so, there's a summoner spell for that. Yeah, you are trading the nice surprise of a good flash stun, but you are gaining a lot from it, too, to be fair. Chase potential, especially on Taric, goes through the roof on that. I can't tell you how many times I have been angry that I couldn't get in one last auto on someone to get that sweet, sweet cd and stun them again. If I was running ghost, I could do that. 

If you didn't lose a lot for changing from flash to ghost, that would be a boring choice. But I think it would be really interesting to try it out, at least. That's theorycrafting at its finest.

So I'm not saying you're necessarily wrong. You might be very right. But as of now, I'm not convinced.

Ignoring unit collision is significant, but not enough to use a summoner spell for it.

Creepblock might deny you a fraction of your initiations. Why use ghost to solve something that only happens a fraction of the time when you could run Exhaust or Ignite in its place, both of which are always going to be useful?

Of course, the ghost MS helps the immobile Taric stay on people. I could see toplane Taric running it.

> [{quoted}](name=Bârd,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AR7o7E0u,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2017-06-09T22:11:14.583+0000)
>
> Ignoring unit collision is significant, but not enough to use a summoner spell for it.
> 
> Creepblock might deny you a fraction of your initiations. Why use ghost to solve something that only happens a fraction of the time when you could run Exhaust or Ignite in its place, both of which are always going to be useful?
> 
> Of course, the ghost MS helps the immobile Taric stay on people. I could see toplane Taric running it.

Flash E is too strong to take ghost.

Yeah, that's kinda what I'm getting at. Ignoring unit collision, plus being able to stick on people and abuse that passive a little better, could be a really nasty combo.

I know a lot of Taric players don't do that right now, but sometimes that's what innovation looks like. Sometimes you test a crazy idea just to see if it will work.

I'm all up for buffs but this one is unnecessary and silly.

Edit: If we allow Taric to have this we might as well let every other champion with a similar issue have it as well.

coming from one of the top 1000 tarics in the world, this would be super helpful.

It is immensely annoying to try and do anything in lane because of minion block

Allow me to propose a similar buff for my main so you can see how much of a bad idea that is. Vi should be able to ignore unit collision while charging her Q.

> [{quoted}](name=NiceTryVi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AR7o7E0u,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2017-06-09T16:13:51.278+0000)
>
> Allow me to propose a similar buff for my main so you can see how much of a bad idea that is. Vi should be able to ignore unit collision while charging her Q.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

So you think he should be able to move through units and stun people, making the only solution to dodging the stun is using a mobility spell? The stun is coming at you from multiple angles, making him ignore unit collision is a bad idea.
